text: running away from the border they're
desperate to cross migrants choke on
tear gas and dodge rubber bullets some
throw stones at the Macedonian police on
the other side others return gas
canisters earlier hundreds had gathered
at the fence that separates Greece from
Macedonia and they believe them from the
better future they came here for they
were responding to rumors that after
weeks of closure the border would open
when they realized the rumors were false
they tried to force the fence even
before we reach the fence they started
firing at us so we ran away but they
reacted they used tear gas and then they
fired stun grenades and rubber bullets
Macedonian police deny firing rubber
bullets that said they used all allowed
chemical means the wind brought tear gas
fumes into this camp on the Greek side
of the border where more than 11,000
migrants are stranded many of them
including small children suffered
breathing problems as a result we
treated around 200 people for four tear
gas mostly men but also women and
children under five years old we had
around 34 trauma patients we also had
some people come in with with the bonnet
body pains bruce's greece has condemned
the use of tear gas by Macedonian police
as dangerous and deplorable tonight calm
has been restored here as has what's
become the grim normality as thousands
sit and wait in the hope that Macedonia
opens the gates Sophie long BBC news on
the greek-macedonian border
